paragraphs.text:
%md

Getting started with Self-Serviced Notebooks

  • Configure snappydata-zeppelin Interpreter
  • Start Snappydata cluster.
  • Start Apache Zeppelin.
  • Import the notebooks in your Zeppelin instance.

Overview

Using these notebooks user can connect to various data-sources by providing required connection parameters. There is a provision to cache/import data from these external data-sources into snappydata tables. User has to provide essential parameters so as to connect to particular data-source. Also additional parameters can be provided in the next step as specified in the respective notebooks.

PART I : Notebooks for accessing below listed databases.

1.mySQL 2.postgreSQL 3.SQLserver 4.Oracle 5.Cassandra 5.mongoDB

PART II : Notebooks to register external data sets sourced from files.

This notebook allows you to register external data sets sourced from files.

We support the following sources:
1.HDFS 2.S3 3.Local files 4.Azure
And file formats:
1.CSV 2.Text 3.JSON 4.Parquet 5.ORC 6.AVRO

Deployiong Connectors to connect to various data-sources

You will need to deploy connector packages for data sources using the notebook Connectors/Deploy-Connectors

Maven Co-ordinates for MYSQL_CONNECTOR :

https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/mysql/mysql-connector-java 1.groupId:mysql 2.artifactId:mysql-connector-java 3.version:8.0.13 Similarly, connectors can be deployed using following package co-ordinates: postgreSQL postgresql:postgresql:9.1-901-1.jdbc4 SQLserver com.microsoft.sqlserver:mssql-jdbc:6.1.0.jre8 Oracle ojdbc14-10.2.0.2.0.jar Cassandra com.datastax.spark:spark-cassandra-connector_2.11:2.3.2 mongoDB org.mongodb.spark:mongo-spark-connector_2.11:2.1.3 For deploying Oracle connector: 1.Download jar file here 2.Deploy that jar using deploy jar command. Refer to the documentation for more details.

NOTE

1.User needs to execute each paragraph one by one 2.Everytime jar is deployed, SnappyData Zeppelin interpreter gives broken pipe / connection refused error. We need to restart SnappyData lead node and then restart Apache Zeppelin to make it work.

Steps To use notebooks:

Check whether required connector(jar) is deployed using the notebook Connectors/Deploy-Connectors 1.Register the dataset using essential connection parameters. 2.Enter additional parameters if required. 2.Take a look at some sample data(imported from data-sources). 4.Cache/import data in SnappyData Column/Row table.

Thesde notebooks are tested against following data-source versions.

mySQL mysql 5.5.61 postgreSQL psql (9.3.24) SQLserver Oracle oracle-ee-11g Cassandra apache-cassandra-3.11.3 mongoDB mongodb 3.6 HDFS hadoop-3.1.1

msg.data:
Getting started with Self-Serviced Notebooks

  • Configure snappydata-zeppelin Interpreter
  • Start Snappydata cluster.
  • Start Apache Zeppelin.
  • Import the notebooks in your Zeppelin instance.

Overview

Using these notebooks user can connect to various data-sources by providing required connection parameters. There is a provision to cache/import data from these external data-sources into snappydata tables. User has to provide essential parameters so as to connect to particular data-source. Also additional parameters can be provided in the next step as specified in the respective notebooks.

PART I : Notebooks for accessing below listed databases.

1.mySQL
2.postgreSQL
3.SQLserver
4.Oracle
5.Cassandra
5.mongoDB

PART II : Notebooks to register external data sets sourced from files.

This notebook allows you to register external data sets sourced from files.

We support the following sources:
1.HDFS
2.S3
3.Local files
4.Azure
And file formats:
1.CSV
2.Text
3.JSON
4.Parquet
5.ORC
6.AVRO

Deployiong Connectors to connect to various data-sources

You will need to deploy connector packages for data sources using the notebook Connectors/Deploy-Connectors

Maven Co-ordinates for MYSQL_CONNECTOR :

https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/mysql/mysql-connector-java 
1.groupId:mysql
2.artifactId:mysql-connector-java
3.version:8.0.13

Similarly, connectors can be deployed using following package co-ordinates:

postgreSQL  postgresql:postgresql:9.1-901-1.jdbc4
SQLserver   com.microsoft.sqlserver:mssql-jdbc:6.1.0.jre8
Oracle      ojdbc14-10.2.0.2.0.jar
Cassandra   com.datastax.spark:spark-cassandra-connector_2.11:2.3.2
mongoDB     org.mongodb.spark:mongo-spark-connector_2.11:2.1.3
For deploying Oracle connector:

1.Download jar file here
2.Deploy that jar using deploy jar command. Refer to the documentation for more details.

NOTE

1.User needs to execute each paragraph one by one
2.Everytime jar is deployed, SnappyData Zeppelin interpreter gives broken pipe / connection refused error. We need to restart SnappyData lead node and then restart Apache Zeppelin to make it work.

Steps To use notebooks:

Check whether required connector(jar) is deployed using the notebook <b>Connectors/Deploy-Connectors</b>
1.Register the dataset using essential connection parameters.
2.Enter additional parameters if required.
2.Take a look at some sample data(imported from data-sources).
4.Cache/import data in SnappyData Column/Row table.

Thesde notebooks are tested against following data-source versions.

mySQL       mysql 5.5.61
postgreSQL  psql (9.3.24)
SQLserver   
Oracle      oracle-ee-11g
Cassandra   apache-cassandra-3.11.3
mongoDB     mongodb 3.6
HDFS        hadoop-3.1.1
